de.javasoft.swing
Class JYTable

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JTable
                  org.jdesktop.swingx.JXTable
                      de.javasoft.swing.JYTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.CellEditorListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener, javax.swing.event.TableColumnModelListener, javax.swing.event.TableModelListener, javax.swing.Scrollable, org.jdesktop.swingx.event.TableColumnModelExtListener
public class JYTable
extends org.jdesktop.swingx.JXTable

JXTable extension with enhanced functionality. Features:

  • api to toggle multiple sorts (requires a RowSorter of type ISortController to be functional)
  • creates and installs a tableHeader of type JYTableHeader which supports multiple sort gestures
  • installs per-column popupMenus to show/hide column/s and configure table/column properties
  • supports an optional filter row component and its corresponding corner action button
  • supports custom ColumnFilterFactories on a per-class and per-column level (similar mechanism as with per-class/per-column TableCellRenderers)
  • supports column resizing by mouse dragging of vertical column separator
  • option to install core default renderers instead of extended SwingX defaults
Note: this table component needs columns of type JYTableColumnExt for complete support of its extended features (specifically, to be able to configure of per-column filterable and filter factories). This column type is created by a ColumnFactory of type JYTableColumnFactory. Client code which wants to use a custom factory should extend the new type. Internally, the new factory type resets the default Singleton to the new (replaces the old default only).

Note: this table components needs a RowSorter of type ISortController for complete support of its (and JXTable!) extended sorter functionality. Developers who want to control the sorter properties themselves and at the same time enable the filterRow support must use a RowSorter extending JYTableSortController.

See Also:
JYTableColumnFactory, FilterRowController, ISortController, Serialized Form

setColumnControlVisible

public void setColumnControlVisible(boolean visible)
Overrides:
setColumnControlVisible in class org.jdesktop.swingx.JXTable

setFilterRowVisible

public void setFilterRowVisible(boolean filterRowVisible)
Sets the filterRowVisible property. If true, a filter row component with per-column filter input components is shown. The row component is added/removed to/from the enclosing JScrollPane. The filter input components are auto-created and kept synched to columModel.

The default value is true.

Note: for automatic addition/removal of the the row filter component, the enclosing ScrollPane must be of type JYTableScrollPane.

Parameters:
filterRowVisible - the filterRowVisible to set.
See Also:
isFilterRowVisible(), getFilterRow(), configureEnclosingScrollPane(), configureFilterRow()

isFilterRowVisible

public boolean isFilterRowVisible()
Returns a boolean indicating whether a filter row with per-column filter input components is showing.

Returns:
the filterRowVisible the filterRowVisible property.
See Also:
setFilterRowVisible(boolean)

getDefaultColumnFilterFactory

public IColumnFilterFactory<? extends javax.swing.table.TableModel> getDefaultColumnFilterFactory(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
Returns the default ColumnFilterFactory for the given column class.

This implementation delegates to its FilterRowController.

Parameters:
clazz - the clazz to lookup the default ColumnFilterFactory
Returns:
the most appropriate ColumnFilterFactory for the given clazz, or the one registered for Object if none found or the clazz is null.
See Also:
setDefaultColumnFilterFactory(Class, IColumnFilterFactory), FilterRowController.getDefaultColumnFilterFactory(Class)

setDefaultColumnFilterFactory

public void setDefaultColumnFilterFactory(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                          IColumnFilterFactory<? extends javax.swing.table.TableModel> factory)
Sets the default factory for columnFilters to use with the specified class.

This implementation delegates to its FilterRowController.

Parameters:
clazz - the Class for with the factory is used, must not be null
factory - the factory to use, may be null to remove a previously registered per-class factory.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if clazz is null
See Also:
getDefaultColumnFilterFactory(Class), #setDefaultColumnFilterFactory(Class, IColumnFilterFactory)

isIncrementalFilter

public boolean isIncrementalFilter()
Returns the incremental property for filtering.

Returns:
the incremental property.
See Also:
setIncrementalFilter(boolean), ColumnFilter.setIncremental(boolean)

setIncrementalFilter

public void setIncrementalFilter(boolean incremental)
Sets the incremental property for filtering.

This property is a hint as to when the RowFilter should be updated on user input into the filtering components shown in the filter row. If true, it is updated while typing. If false, it is updated after the user commits the input value. The actual behaviour is controlled by the column filter.

The default value is true.

Parameters:
incremental - sets the incremental property
See Also:
isIncrementalFilter(), ColumnFilter.setIncremental(boolean)

configureFilterRow

protected void configureFilterRow()
Configures the filter row (as subheader) of an enclosing JScrollPane. Here: Adds the filter row subheader and its corner if the filterRowVisible is true and there's an enclosing scrollPane of type JYTableScrollPane. Does nothing otherwise.

See Also:
setFilterRowVisible(boolean)

unconfigureFilterRow

protected void unconfigureFilterRow()
Unconfigures the filter row (as subheader) of an enclosing JScrollPane. Here: removes the filter row subheader and its corner.

See Also:
setFilterRowVisible(boolean)

getSortIndex

public int getSortIndex(int columnIndex)
Returns the sort index of the column. Aka it's position in the list of sort keys, if contained and sorted, or -1 if not or the RowSorter is not of type ISortController.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the column in view coordinates
Returns:
the sort index
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column index is not valid
See Also:
ISortController.getSortIndex(int)

getSortCount

public int getSortCount()
Returns the number of sorted columns, if the RowSorter is of type ISortController. Returns 0, otherwise.

Returns:
the number of sorted columns
See Also:
ISortController.getSortCount()

toggleSortOrder

public void toggleSortOrder(int columnIndex,
                            boolean isMultipleSort)
Toggles the sort order of the given column and sort type. Does nothing if the RowSorter is not of type ISortController.

The exact behaviour is defined by the SortController's toggleSortOrder implementation. Typically a unsorted column is sorted in ascending order, a sorted column's order is reversed.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the column to toggle in view coordinates
isMultipleSort - a flag indicating whether the sort type is multiple or single
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the columnIndex is not valid
See Also:
ISortController.toggleSortOrder(int, boolean)

public void toggleSortOrder(int columnIndex)

setColumnResizable

public void setColumnResizable(boolean resizable)
Sets the columnResizable property. Allows to resize column widths by dragging the mouse over the vertical cell border lines, if true.

The default value is true.

Parameters:
resizable - a boolean indicating whether column widths should be resizable inside the table.
See Also:

useCoreRenderers

protected boolean useCoreRenderers()
Returns a boolean indicating whether this table's default renderers should be core or swingx types.

Note: using core renderers most possibly short-cuts the SwingX rendering mechanism, in regard to both the visual decoration and content formatting. It's up client code to handle any side-effects introduced by this. This implementation checks the UIManager for a Boolean of value TRUE under the key "Table.useCoreRenderers") and returns true if found, false otherwise.

Returns:
a flag indicating whether core renderers should be installed.
See Also:
JXTable.resetDefaultTableCellRendererColors(java.awt.Component, int, int), JXTable.getStringAt(int, int), JXTable.getStringValueRegistry()

createCoreRenderers

protected void createCoreRenderers()
Creates and installs default core renderers.

isColumnControlActionKey

protected boolean isColumnControlActionKey(java.lang.Object actionKey)
Returns a boolean indicating whether the given actionkey maps to an action in the column control.

Here: true if a String key starts with #COLUMN_CONTROL_MARKER.

Parameters:
actionKey - a key in the table's actionMap.
Returns:
a boolean to indicate whether the given actionKey maps to an action which should be included into the popup.

getUIClassID

public java.lang.String getUIClassID()
Returns a string that specifies the name of the L&F class that renders this component.

Overrides:

Returns:
the string "JYTableUI"
See Also:
JComponent.getUIClassID(), UIDefaults.getUI(javax.swing.JComponent)
